newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - March 4.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - March 4.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Tuesday:

* On Monday, the Dow Jones industrial average jumped 41.18 points to 6,918.92 after losing more than 160 points in the last three sessions as the market recovered from Federal Reserve Chairman Alan Greenspan's remarks last Wednesday about high stock prices and possibly higher interest rates.
* According to newspaper reports, Indonesia's trade surplus in 1996 increased to $6.9 billion.
* On Monday, the Jakarta Composite Index closed 5.27 points, or 0.75 percent, lower at 700.11 points on profit-taking led by tobacoo heavyweight Sampoerna, brokers said.
* On Tuesday, the rupiah was quoted at 2,395.25/96.25 at 0145 GMT, compared with an opening of 2,395.00/96.00
* Property firm PT Lippo Land on its announcement that it posted first-half (July-December) net profit of 40.6 billion rupiah against 24.18 billion rupiah in 1995.
Also on market speculation that foreign investors were interested in buying a large stake in the company from the market.
* Hotel Sahid Jaya on market talk of a possible rights issue to finance its expansion programme.

* Cigarette maker Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna after Thursday's annnouncement it posted a net profit of 394 billion rupiah in 1996, compared with its target of 423 billion rupiah coupled with news that its overseas subsidiary might continue making losses for three to four years.
* Property firm Elang Realty on news that the privately-owned Bakrie Group had purchased a stake in the company and would merge two banks in the two groups.
* Agribusiness firm Anwar Sierad after the company won shareholder approval for a stock split.

* Indonesia's largest noodle maker PT Indofood Sukses Makmur on its announcement last week that 1997 consolidated net sales would exceed five trillion rupiah in line with its plan to acquire six companies controlled by tycoon Liem Sioe Liong.
* Coffee, rubber and tapioca trading firm Prasidha Aneka Niaga on analyst expectations that its 1997 revenues would be higher on strong coffee prices.
* Retailer Matahari on news that its 1996 net profit fell to 15.1 bilion rupiah against 38.8 billion rupiah in 1995.
* Retailer Ramayana Lestari Sentosa on revising up its 1997 net profit forecast to around 90.2 billion rupiah from 83.3 billion.
